docs.lead_paragraph: Acccording to a prominent Orthodox rabbi, nothing is so revolting to the third-generation American Jew as the sight of his Hasidic brethren on the street. With their Yiddish accents and East European clothing, the story goes, they remind him of something he had a nose job to forget.

headline.main: The call of the ghetto; The Lubavitchers believe it takes only a little stoking to ignite the spark of religion in every Jew Lubavitchers ' I dabbled in Zen Buddhism and L.S.D. ... then someone said to me, "Why not give your own religion a chance?"'

docs.abstract: Ray Schultz article on Lubavitcher movement of Hasidic Jews, led by Rabbi Menachem M Schneerson; describes their proselytizing on NYC sts, their founding in 18th century, their religious, soc and educational traditions; describes Chabbad houses, relief centers for students; illus of Lubavitchers (L)
